hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Stress Transition on Volatility Spike & Volume Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes, when BTC experiences a ≥12% intraday drawdown with closing price recovery to within 3% of open, but on below-average volume (<85% of 20-day avg), followed by a failed breakout attempt (rejection at prior high) within 3 days, the regime transitions to STRESS within 5 trading days with >60% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Large intraday shocks with weak volume recovery suggest distribution by large holders. Failed follow-through indicates weakening momentum, often preceding bull market corrections or volatility expansions into STRESS regimes.
entry_conditions: BTC closes within 3% of daily open
Next 3 days: BTC fails to break above pre-drawdown high (rejection wick ≥2%)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC makes new high above pre-drawdown level on >avg volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 50% transition rate to STRESS OR median max drawdown after signal <8%.
